transportAdvice: Bratislava's compact old town is very walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot; the city also has a reliable network of trams, buses, and trolleybuses that connect tourist areas to wider neighborhoods. Taxis are widely available and metered, though agreeing on a fare or using a metered cab from a reputable rank is advisable.

weather.description: Cold and often grey with occasional snow, making it the quietest month for tourism but atmospheric for winter walks.
Still cold with possible snow and frost, though daylight hours begin to lengthen noticeably.
Early spring brings mild days and occasional showers, with the city starting to come alive outdoors.
Pleasant and increasingly warm with blooming parks, though rain showers remain common throughout the month.
One of the best months to visit, with warm temperatures, green scenery, and lively outdoor caf√© culture.
Warm and sunny with occasional thunderstorms, ideal for exploring the old town and riverside areas.
The hottest month, with long sunny days and a vibrant outdoor atmosphere, though afternoon storms are possible.
Similarly hot to July with plenty of sunshine, making it peak season for outdoor sightseeing and river activities.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures with fewer crowds and the start of harvest season in the surrounding wine region.
Crisp and colourful with autumn foliage, cooler evenings, and a relaxed pace as the tourist season winds down.
Cool and often overcast with increasing rain, though the city's Christmas markets begin to open late in the month.
Cold and festive, with charming Christmas markets in the old town making it a popular and atmospheric time to visit.
